results.title: Nixon: from Checkers to Watergate
results.creator_credit: Charles Braverman, Ken Rudolf and Braverman Productions
results.brief_description: A compilation of archival stills and motion picture photography showing Nixon’s speeches, interviews and press conferences as candidate, congressman, vice-president and president.

results.title: Basic film editing
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford Educational Films and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: This film illustrates basic techniques of piecing a film together. The camera viewpoint, as well as long, medium and close-up shots, are manipulated to vary effects. No other credits available.

results.title: The Tool users
results.creator_credit: Jack Kaufman Productions and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: Demonstrates that humans are not the only animal that has developed the ability to fashion and use tools. Shows a variety of animals using tools in their daily routine. Narrated by Leslie Nielsen.

results.title: Tobias on the evolution of man
results.brief_description:
Summarises Phillip Tobias’ contribution to paleoanthropology. He discusses the evolution of man, considering various hominid species and their relationship to homosapiens.
Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Spiders: aggression and mating
results.brief_description: Features the aggressive characteristics of the spider, showing how webs are used to trap prey. Shows how male and female must suspend aggressive behaviour in order to mate.

results.title: Konrad Lorenz: science of animal behaviour
results.creator_credit: Jack Kaufman Productions and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: Documents the work of Konrad Lorenz in animal behaviour, describing his studies with wild geese and his findings on the function of rank in animal social structure. Shows his experiments concerning imprinting and communication, where the geese adopt the experimenter as mother immediately after birth. Narrated by Leslie Nielsen.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack Kaufman Productions and National Geographic Society
results.description: Documents the work of Konrad Lorenz in animal behaviour, describing his studies with wild geese and his findings on the function of rank in animal social structure. Shows his experiments concerning imprinting and communication, where the geese adopt the experimenter as mother immediately after birth. Narrated by Leslie Nielsen.

results.title: Is recycling a load of old rubbish?
results.brief_description: This film gives an overview of the garbage crisis in Australia, the direct result of prepackaging and disposals. Alternative methods of rubbish disposal are examined.

results.title: Building a house: where does it come from?
results.creator_credit: Charles Cahill and Charles Cahill and Associates
results.brief_description: Describes the men and material involved in building a home and traces the manufacturing processes used in producing the materials and products used in home construction.

results.title: World of darkness
results.brief_description: Edited from the motion picture entitled ‘Strange creatures of the night’, the film examines a variety of creatures, including bats, owls, and a blind lizard that live and hunt in the darkness. Excellent footage of the animals in their natural environment. There is an information booklet inside each can.
